channel.title: Buzzing on Quora
channel.description: 用中文浏览Quora上的热门回答

item.title: Why is forgiving student loans so important for our citizens and the economy? California Congressman, @ericswalwell, explains. https://t.co/4GLEDQ60l7 https://t.co/V8l4GRC9Ha
What can both employers and employees do to contribute to a work/life balance? Answer by @CWaltersPhD, business & branding mentor. https://t.co/56XjkoJkae https://t.co/iYsxd3aGds
Do only humans have genders? Frans de Waal, biologist, primatologist, professor at Emory University, and author of 'Different', shares his insights. https://t.co/XNnht1tafm https://t.co/iYFDJ2nmfk

What are your top 5 tips for avoiding employee burnout? Charlene Walters PhD (@CWaltersPhD), Business & Branding Mentor and Corporate Trainer, shares her best advice: https://t.co/hvPKdp6hg4 https://t.co/Bx6PlE95NM

How will the midterm elections shape the next two years of Biden's presidency? California Congressman, @ericswalwell, says 'we still have a lot of work to do.' https://t.co/jRESQZz9zP https://t.co/o5WAe51Oib
The #HoliFestival is celebrated around the world. How did you celebrate? https://t.co/gU5e1rSp7m https://t.co/fN55yABst3

What are the issues facing women in Afghanistan today, and how can the international community support them? Nisha Singh, Global Policy and Advocacy Manager at @WomenforWomen @womenforwomenUK, shares unique insights on this important topic. Read them here: https://t.co/Y0ugy8c2dE https://t.co/hzrDmTLB30
Mathematician @alonamit says quaternions are awesome. Do you agree? https://t.co/1Y7eRHnS33
How is aging and care for the aging changing? Answer by Lawrence Kosick (@lawrencekosick), President and Co-Founder at GetSetUp. https://t.co/FIVizW9mFt https://t.co/ZZEAdAyjsR
"Unlike that other media personality turned president, Zelenskyy showed up when shit got real." What is unique about President Zelenskyy's leadership style? by Franklin Veaux https://t.co/zjCidSjflU

How can you leverage your team to build a radically adaptable organization? Keith Ferrazzi (@ferrazzi), Bestselling Author and Ferrazzi Greenlight Founder, explains how to make your organization agile. Read his advice here: https://t.co/vShN89kKbL https://t.co/FFQpN98Zvi

Is there a difference on how yoga in the U.S. is different than what is practiced in India? Arunima Singhdeo (@arunima), CEO of https://t.co/OznUabzWjG, answers here: https://t.co/xFvwP4Eo0U https://t.co/bKnIUyCrZH

How can you build self awareness in conversations? Katie McCleary, Co Founder: How to Bridge the Gap & Podcast on NPR CapRadio and author of @bridgethegapbk, explains how having the right people around you is crucial. Read her full piece here: https://t.co/FDwcHyMGFa https://t.co/9jjl8Hnycu

How can leaders measure whether or not their teams are resilient? Keith Ferrazzi (@ferrazzi), Bestselling Author and Ferrazzi Greenlight Founder, says regular assessments are key. Read what he has to say here: https://t.co/CkyfNltMUO https://t.co/KBdkaJ1vED
Do customers really like personalization, or do they find it creepy? @AlexandreRbcqt, CEO @Crossing_Minds shares insights. https://t.co/uQgjuLV3bX https://t.co/2PIYdCOojY
Getting excited for the Oscars later this month? Ken Miyamoto (@KenMovies), screen writer and script reader, shares some fun Oscars history! https://t.co/DiM5X9nrAL

What are some approaches to help people stay mentally, physically, and socially healthy as they age? Answer by Lawrence Kosick (@lawrencekosick), President and Co-Founder at GetSetUp. https://t.co/NBvIXLeI4w https://t.co/NWBcbj6jG0
Whatever happened to Nancy Kerrigan? Quora star writer Stephanie Vardavas has the story, straight from the source! https://t.co/WhzBWHy4bu

We have been wondering this, seeing all the Cyrillic script about lately. How similar are Russian and Ukrainian? Are they mutually intelligible or more like Spanish and Portuguese? https://t.co/dMPiMmza3p

Ready for more behind-the-scenes movie secrets? Read this piece by @NorthwesternU film professor, Clayton Brown: How powerful is the cameraman in moviemaking? https://t.co/c5rUDZTm3E https://t.co/VslQqqYLr5

How can leaders break down initiatives into bite-sized milestones that can be built upon? Kian Gohar (@fromthekgb), CEO at Geolab, says, "rather than getting lost in vague visions, the most successful teams identify short-term goals." Read his piece here: https://t.co/mLqLLe4N10 https://t.co/04KijDPh8Q
What are the best yoga exercises for anxiety? Arunima Singhdeo (@arunima), CEO at https://t.co/OznUabzWjG, gives expert advice. https://t.co/jtP38Gy85I https://t.co/99NQYjirqx

How can you use curiosity as a tool to improve your relationships at work? Katie McCleary, Co Founder: How to Bridge the Gap & Podcast on NPR CapRadio, shares 3 ways. https://t.co/K4R62HbB2u https://t.co/DYM7VQiWxr
Which warrior was the most dangerous in singles combat in the history of the world? https://t.co/4TjiircFO9 https://t.co/dSp1VAMIrQ
What are some ways to make friends and find a community as you age? Answer by Lawrence Kosick (@lawrencekosick), President and Co-Founder at GetSetUp. https://t.co/S1Rwj4VAbx https://t.co/Tkb2PcVJb0
Does the west have a satellite with a weapon, such as a laser that can disable the Russian convoy? Bill Otto, engineer on the Space Based Laser project, explains: https://t.co/EH55WHBTS6

If Vladimir Putin went off the deep end and decided to unilaterally launch a nuclear strike on the United States, could he do it? Do the Russians have any system in place to prevent one unstable person from starting WW3? Andrey Yanovski explains: https://t.co/piPg4HfPDb
What's it like in Kyiv right now? Find out from Yulia Ko, resident: https://t.co/ugXdnOXwcy
It's Mardi Gras Day in New Orleans and we're missing the parades and the king cake. Anyone in New Orleans want to send us one? https://t.co/8ADohUNZ4a https://t.co/kLgwLTSRM2

When you think of the Netherlands, you may think of a country below sea level with windmills, canals, and tulip fields. Did you know 90% of Europe's desert areas are in the Netherlands? Andrew Simons has the surprising details: https://t.co/xXLE2bPIb5 https://t.co/DGGkW8ub15

Has the pandemic finally proved we can never “go back” to work? Kian Gohar (@fromthekgb), CEO at Geolab, says, "The pandemic gave us permission to explore a new world of work without boundaries." To read more about Kian's insights, read his piece here: https://t.co/cCLb7BGjh0 https://t.co/wleCuasY5D

How can you confront microaggressions and outdated norms in the workplace? Author of 'The First, The Few, The Only: How Women of Color Can Redefine Power in Corporate America', @DeepaPuru, shares best practices. https://t.co/SLxos7cyTW https://t.co/HwuSY3RbBf
What is your formula for pursuing your passion? Founder @classpass, @PayalKadakia, shares her personal experience. https://t.co/CnOa5ozxXZ https://t.co/k4HqjKgwdC

Congress recently approved a bill to nullify forced arbitration in sexual assault or harassment cases. What are the implications for employers? Chief HR Legal Expert, Kara Govro, explains. https://t.co/dYTKSmzuoP https://t.co/xuiu4guYn0
What is the "dinosaur size gap"? Tomaž Vargazon explains: https://t.co/OcTGiIwZ9P https://t.co/oDoMzZnX86
This is a cool trick? What #lifehacks have you learned on Quora? https://t.co/46Hxd0m5mS

What problems are businesses facing when it comes to understanding their data? CEO & Founder of @sisudata Peter Bailis (@pbailis) shares his professional insights. https://t.co/J0Q1lZPGD5 https://t.co/wxeJkf1v6x

How many of you learned that North America was populated by early human crossing a land bridge from Siberia to Alaska? Colleen Anne Coyle describes some recent #archaeology findings that suggest people came by sea, not by land, and MUCH earlier! https://t.co/rl4N4uI81l

What does the phrase “majority minority” refer to, and when will the United States population reach this milestone? Associate Professor of Policy and Government @GeorgeMasonU @ScharSchool Immigration / Demographic Change, @_JustinGest explains. https://t.co/KlTyGvoEPJ https://t.co/DbRuFX6ZKa

Five directors were nominated for an Academy Award this year. Want to know how they got their films in theaters? Clayton Brown, documentary film maker and professor @NorthwesternU, shares how it's done. https://t.co/d4VaygerOo https://t.co/eh5VUuIq9n
What do philosophers think about Jordan Peterson? @fmdolan gives us some insight: https://t.co/NnqROyOVFe
What is early application and how can I use it to my advantage? CEO, Crimson Education, @JamieBeaton_nz, breaks it down: https://t.co/2VEMeieYiS https://t.co/O7XzbHcfmT
Who's #hiking this weekend? Has anyone done part of the Pacific Coast Trail? Barbara has and shares some valuable insights: https://t.co/SsnPaUhkTe

President & CEO of @sffed (San Francisco Federal Reserve), @MaryDalyEcon answers the questions everyone wants to know: Will the labor market improve in 2022? And why are so many job openings not getting filled? https://t.co/SKoe6wLRTt https://t.co/QdZXKWW5EW

Did you know that King Nebuchadnezzar II, famous for the Hanging Gardens of Babylon, built an enormous labyrinth around his palace that still exists today? Silvia Serra shares the story in the Wonders of the Past Space: https://t.co/lfvP23Dhmf https://t.co/RGhBj4CVo5
Why is a green screen green and not some other color? Clayton Brown explains the science behind it: https://t.co/3OMnkGY5iq
Have you ever seen a firetruck with an oddly-specific notice to stay back 343 feet? Firefighter David Wayne explains why: https://t.co/xC1bTk2ljv

How can you use statistics to increase your changes of school admissions? CEO, Crimson Education, @JamieBeaton_nz, explains two crucial ways you can use numbers to your advantage. https://t.co/kaIeT062GS https://t.co/Tgea5HWhpu
Did Harriet Tubman have an adopted daughter? Here's what historians think: https://t.co/HXKvOlyXjE https://t.co/2rJf7eewBf

At Quora, we talk a lot about sharing knowledge, but what do we mean by that? When you think of knowledge, you may first think about one specific kind - knowing facts about the world. This is referred to in @vervaeke_john's lectures as perspectival knowing, but there are others!
